intro: Psychotria amboniana var. velutina, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It has small, elliptical leaves with a dense pubescence that gives it a soft, velvety texture. The flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are often visited by various pollinators.
